Authors: Gui A., Haron H., Sabrina C., Timoti J., Yusuf M., Pratiwi S.D.
Title: Information technology risk management using FRAP (A case of insurance company)
Affiliations: Computerized Accounting Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, 9, Jl Kh Syahdan, Jakarta, Indonesia; Audit Department, Advanced Management Center, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang Island, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Gui, A., Computerized Accounting Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, 9, Jl Kh Syahdan, Jakarta, Indonesia; Haron, H., Audit Department, Advanced Management Center, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang Island, Malaysia; Sabrina, C., Computerized Accounting Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, 9, Jl Kh Syahdan, Jakarta, Indonesia; Timoti, J., Computerized Accounting Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, 9, Jl Kh Syahdan, Jakarta, Indonesia; Yusuf, M., Computerized Accounting Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, 9, Jl Kh Syahdan, Jakarta, Indonesia; Pratiwi, S.D., Computerized Accounting Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, 9, Jl Kh Syahdan, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study was to determine how the application of information technology and the risks of what might happen. Research methods used include literature studies, field studies by conducting observations, interview and study documentation. The approach used to conduct risk management of information technology is a method of Facilitated Risk Analysis Process (FRAP). The results are the discovery of the risks of using information technology. The conclusions of this study demonstrate the application of information technology is good enough because it takes only a little improvement in information technology risk management. © (2013) Trans Tech Publications, Switzerland.
Index Keywords: Analysis process; Application of information technologies; Field studies; FRAP; Information technology risks; Insurance companies; Literature studies; Insurance; Product design; Risk management; Information technology
